message_1:
A traveling salesman has to visit 6 different cities. The distances between the cities are given below - 

City  | A | B | C | D | E | F 
------|---|---|---|---|---|---
A     | 0 | 5 | 2 | 4 | 9 | 1
B     | 5 | 0 | 7 | 3 | 8 | 6
C     | 2 | 7 | 0 | 6 | 3 | 1
D     | 4 | 3 | 6 | 0 | 2 | 9
E     | 9 | 8 | 3 | 2 | 0 | 5
F     | 1 | 6 | 1 | 9 | 5 | 0

What is the shortest possible route the salesman can take to visit all the cities and return to the starting city?
message_2:

(4 factorial) or 24 possible routes.
